title.rendered: AI Research Intern at General Electric, Bengaluru [Stipend Available]: Apply Now!

content.rendered:
Online applications are invited for the AI Research Intern at General Electric, Bengaluru. Check the eligibility and other details below!

About GE

General Electric Company is an American multinational conglomerate founded in 1892 incorporated in the state of New York and headquartered in Boston. The company has several divisions, including aerospace, power, renewable energy, digital industry, additive manufacturing, and venture capital and finance. GE rises to the challenge of building a world that works. For more than 125 years, GE has invented the future of industry, and today the company’s dedicated team, leading technology, and global reach and capabilities help the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely.

Job Description: AI Research Intern

AI Research Intern will work in research teams addressing Medical Image Analysis and Computer Vision problems in a commercial technology and consultancy development environment. In this role, you will contribute to the development of modern deep learning methods for finding structure in large data sets.

Responsibilities

  • Work with AI Scientists to design and implementation of advanced deep learning models, to automate and enhance clinical tasks utilizing diverse data sets like medical images, electronic health records, patient waveforms, and clinical reports.
  • Evaluate and summarize the state-of-the-art algorithm pipelines for specific clinical applications.
  • Ensure the precision and applicability of algorithms across varied patient diversity through comprehensive statistical analysis and error estimation.
  • Facilitate the development of versatile software, emphasizing reusability and scalability.

Required Qualifications

  • Students pursuing PhD or Masters by research in Computer Science or “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) at reputed educational institutions
  • Technical Expertise:
    • Expertise in Medical Image Analysis and Computer Vision topics
    • Demonstrated mastery of Python and in the use of AI stacks – PyTorch/Tensorflow
    • Demonstrated skill at data cleansing, data quality assessment, and using analytics for data assessment
    • Demonstrated skill in the use of applied analytics, descriptive statistics, and predictive analytics on industrial datasets

Desired Characteristics

  • Technical background in any of the following areas: Controls systems Engineering, Robotics, Machine Learning is desired for the role of Research Intern AI/ML.
  • Experience in AI/ML

How to Apply?

Interested candidates for AI Research Intern at General Electric can directly apply through this link!

Location

  • Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
  • Relocation assistance will be provided.
